Question: Most of this person's greatest post-1599 plays were written for the Globe, including Hamlet, Othello and King Lear.
Hints: Another 18th-century story has this person starting his theatrical career minding the horses of theatre patrons in London.
This person's work has made a lasting impression on later theatre and literature.
This person is also supposed to have taken his revenge on Lucy by writing a scurrilous ballad about him.
